timeline.bodyText:
classes in com.azure.cosmos.models are part of our public api.
Does ResourceWrapper have to be in com.azure.cosmos.models ?
timeline.author: moderakh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.cosmos.models;

replies.bodyText:
Put in the models with the following thinking:
Since we moved Resource into implementation, so some method has changed from private package to public.  If I remove ResourceWrapper to implementation, then the getResource() will change to public which may expose methods we did not/should not?
But it can be solved by two ways: (if move to implementation)

remove getResource() method
change to protected, have some implmentionBridge class to use this method from other places

thoughts?
replies.author: xinlian12
kushagraThapar

timeline.message:
i# This is a combination of 2 commits.

a typo in previous PR

fix

timeline.bodyText:
Since these API names got changed in CosmosContainerProperties, we should update them here too.
setAnalyticalStoreTimeToLiveInSeconds
Not in this PR - since this is implementation change, we should do this in a follow up PR.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: CosmosError is in models (public surface) - and is still extending internal types Resource and JsonSerializable. This is exposed using CosmosClientException which can lead to potential exposure of Jackson libraries.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: This is a cosmosdb management related library change, not ours :)
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure yet if we should have JsonSerializableWrapper, but if we decide to go with JsonSerializable, then you could move this code to JsonSerializable and and here just have super(jsonStirng).
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: yup, good idea to move the common code into the parent class
replies.author: xinlian12

replies.bodyText: based on the discussion, will remove JsonSerializableWrapper and ResourceWrapper in  following up PR.
replies.author: xinlian12

timeline.bodyText: We are validating these resources in RxDocumentClientImpl anyway, so we could skip these altogether? same for database too. Minor change, need not worry about this in this PR.
timeline.author: mbhaskar
